thread.title: Ange rewards A-League veteran with rare Roos call
thread.title_full: Ange rewards A-League veteran with rare Roos call

title: Ange rewards A-League veteran with rare Roos call
text:
Socceroos extended squad: Danny Vukovic rewarded for strong Sydney FC form by Ange Postecoglou March 8, 2017 6:00am @davidweiner9 Source: FOX SPORTS SEVEN years since his last Socceroos call-up, Danny Vukovic will be a part of the national team set-up. 
The Sydney FC goalkeeper will be announced as one of the bolters in Ange Postecoglou’s extended 30-man squad for Australia’s World Cup qualifiers against Iraq and United Arab Emirates this month. 
Vukovic, 31, is uncapped at senior international level but has sat on the bench three times for his country in Asian Cup qualifiers, with his last call-up in January 2010. 
His selection, alongside European regulars Mathew Ryan and Mitch Langerak, is a reward for a commanding season between the sticks for the A-League leaders – another example that compelling form and consistent game time tends not to go unnoticed in Postecoglou’s Socceroos selections. 
As part of Graham Arnold’s impressive rear guard, Vukovic has conceded just 11 times in 22 appearances, keeping 12 clean sheets while producing some clutch saves throughout the Sky Blues’ astonishing Premiership campaign. 
It was the type of form former Socceroos goalkeeper Mark Bosnich felt warranted a national team call-up. Danny Vukovic, Mark Schwarzer and Adam Federici in 2009. Source: News Limited 
“I know Maty Ryan played a wonderful role — he’s on loan at the minute at Genk ... he was outstanding against his old club Brugges on the weekend, so obviously he’s in good form as well,” he told Fox Sports’ Shootout program on Sunday. 
“Mitch Langerak has been playing really well in Germany, Brad Jones at Feyenoord (too). 
“But we’ve had the pleasure of seeing Danny Vukovic week in, week out this season. 
“He’s been up there as one of the signings of the season ... he seems to make these (great) saves at very important times.” Socceroos Danny Vukovic spins the ball on his fingers as coach Pim Verbeek looks on. Source: News Limited 
The selection is a sweet reward in a significant year on and off the pitch for the custodian, who moved from Melbourne Victory to Sydney FC this season so that his family could concentrate on helping young son, Harley, in his battle with biliary atresia, a condition that blocks bile ducts and causes liver damage. 
Indeed, earlier this year V ukovic revealed that treatment had been successful , with his attitude throughout praised by his club coach. Vukovic's touching moment 0:57 
“It has saved his life. It shows the importance of organ donation,” Vukovic told Fox Sports after the match. “We’ll be forever grateful.” 
Arnold said at the time: “It’s a wonderful story. 
“His son is doing exceptionally well. That would be a huge relief for them. For probably three to four weeks, he was sleeping on the floor of a hospital and still performing the way he did.” 
The former Central Coast, Wellington and Perth goalkeeper, who is the most capped A-League player in the competition’s history with 272 appearances, has been overlooked as a back-up goalkeeper over the past decade for the likes of Eugene Galekovic, Ante Covic, Brad Jones, Adam Federici, Mark Birighitti and Alex Cisak. Goalkeeper Danny Vukovic. Picture: Jonathan Ng Source: News Corp Australia 
Vukovic has spoken recently about his growing maturity on the pitch , and his return to the national team is a perfect example of that, coming almost 10 years after he had been due to keep for Australia’s under-23s at the 2008 Beijing Olympics, but was banned for making contact with referee Mark Shield when the Mariners went down to Newcastle Jets in the 2007-2008 A-League grand final. 
The full Socceroos squad will be announced at 9.30am AEDT on Wednesday, followed by a press conference at 10.30am, which you can watch live on foxsports.com.au 13/03/2007: Danny Vukovic. Source: News Limited View All Comments The latest sports news, in your inbox daily. Email
